original: zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes pa smos te /

analyzed: rung ba zhes bya ba ni yid la bsam pa grub pa'i tshul te 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nyams su myong ba'o //

analyzed: gang nas ji srid du mthong zhe na /

analyzed: gang nas ji srid kyi bar du zhe na /

analyzed: sems par byed pa ni @124b rnal 'byor te yang dag pa yid la byed pas 'jug pa'o //

analyzed: rab tu rnam par spong ba zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i khyad par gyi mthus yongs su 'dor ba'o //

analyzed: re zhig dgag pa'i gnyen po bstan pa'i phyir 'bad pa zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: tshangs spyod spyod pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /

original: 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pas so //

analyzed: gang dag de ltar 'jug pa nyid ni drang srong chen po'i cha byad rigs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /

original: gang zhig snyigs ma yod bzhin du ;
analyzed: gang zhig snyigs ma yod bzhin du ;
translated: How can one who has defilements

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag go //

analyzed: lhas bskul nas 'od ma'i tshal na gnas pa'i bram ze dang khyim bdag dag gis ko ka li ka'i thad du lhags te smras pa /

original: khyod la 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyod la 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is not right for youüîΩbecause we do not like it when you conflict with the great disciples.‚Äù

analyzed: nyan thos chen po dag dang 'gal bar byed pas nged cag kyang dga' ba ma yin no zhes pa dang / de phrag dog gis sdig pa 'dod cing tshig mi snyan pas bya bar byed do //

original: ji tsam na tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la khyod song la 'od ma'i tshal gyi lam srang dang bzhi mdo dag tu tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di thon cig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ji tsam na tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la khyod song la 'od ma'i tshal gyi lam srang dang bzhi mdo dag tu tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di thon cig ces gsungs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ananda: ‚ÄúGo and recite these two verses in the streets and squares of the Bamboo Grove.‚Äù

analyzed: 'dod chags kyis kun nas bslang ba'i lus la sogs pa'i las ni snyigs ma ste /

analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir dang / zil gyis gnon par byed pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni snyigs ma yod bzhin du zhes bya ba yin te /

analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras phyis pa yin te snyigs ma dang bcas pa ni nyes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: snyigs mas bslad pa'i phyir te gsum pa'o //
analyzed: snyigs mas bslad pa'i phyir te gsum pa'o //

analyzed: ngur smrig gos zhes bya ba ni shing gi rtsa ba lta bu ste /

analyzed: nog po la sogs pa bskol ba las byung ba'i chon gyis bsgyur ba'i gos de ni gos tshon can te ngur smrig gi gos so //

analyzed: des 'gebs shing bkab pa ni gyon pa'o //

analyzed: dul dang des pa med pa zhes bya ba la dul ba ni dbang po sngom pa'o //
translated: The phrase lacking in self-control and gentleness means that self-control is the restraint of the sensory faculties,

analyzed: des pa ni sems dul ba ste dge ba la mngon par dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and gentleness is the control of the mind, because it generates a delight in virtue.

original: yang na nges @125a * //
analyzed: yang na nges @125a * //
translated: Alternatively, self-control is patience,

original: pa ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni bzod pa'o //
translated: and gentleness is the absence of anger.

original: dul ba dang des pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni de'o //
analyzed: dul ba dang des pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni de'o //
translated: One who is devoid of self-control and gentleness is called lacking in self-control and gentleness.

analyzed: de nyid kyis ni drang srong chen po'i rgyal mtshan nam dur smrig gi gos yongs su bgo bar rigs pa ma yin no //

analyzed: gang zhig snyigs ma rnams spangs nas zhes bya ba ni gang yang snyigs ma yongs su spangs par gyur pa'o //

analyzed: tshul khrims la brten pa nyid kyis ni yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: tshul khrims legs par mnyam gzhag pa // zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: so sor thar ba'i sdom pa la shin tu gus pas 'jug pa'o //
translated: means that he is well-equipoised in the morality of restraint.üîΩHe is well-equipoised in the morality of collecting virtue because he is engaged in the collections of merit and knowledge.üîΩ He is well-equipoised in the morality of benefitting sentient beings because he is engaged in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: yang na snyigs ma spangs pa nyid kyis ni tshul khrims la sogs pa spong ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na snyigs ma spangs pa nyid kyis ni tshul khrims la sogs pa spong ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, in order to teach that the abandonment of the defilements does not imply the abandonment of morality, etc.,

original: tshul khrims zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: tshul khrims zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says: ‚Äúmorality,‚Äù etc.

original: dul dang nges par sngom pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yid dam /
analyzed: dul dang nges par sngom pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yid dam /
translated: ‚ÄúSelf-control‚Äù and ‚Äúrestraint‚Äù refer to the control of the senses and the mind.

original: de bzhin du bzod pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzod pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: Likewise, because of his patience,

original: de ni de nyid de sngar bstan pa'i skyon dang bral zhing yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni skye bo dge ba'i tshul du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no /üîΩg-yo sgyu 'jungs dang ldan ba'i mi //
analyzed: de ni de nyid de sngar bstan pa'i skyon dang bral zhing yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni skye bo dge ba'i tshul du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no / g-yo sgyu 'jungs dang ldan ba'i mi //
translated: he becomes a person of virtue, because of his freedom from the faults and his possession of the virtues taught above, and not otherwise.üîΩ‚ÄúThe person who is deceitful, hypocritical, and avaricious,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: dge slong zhig mchog tu mdzes la kha dgo bzang zhing sha rgyas pa dang ldan pa thos pa mang zhing snyan par smra ba /
analyzed: dge slong zhig mchog tu mdzes la kha dgo bzang zhing sha rgyas pa dang ldan pa thos pa mang zhing snyan par smra ba /
translated: A certain monk was extremely handsome, had a good complexion, was well-built, was learned, and spoke pleasantly.

original: g-yo sgyu che zhing ser sna dang ldan pa zhig rung ba dang gzhan 'dod pa chung ba las dgra bcom par gyur cing dgon pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: g-yo sgyu che zhing ser sna dang ldan pa zhig rung ba dang gzhan 'dod pa chung ba las dgra bcom par gyur cing dgon pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: He is suitable if he is very deceitful, greedy, and has few desires, and becomes an arhat and lives in the forest.

original: de las tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de las tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: Two verses are stated about him.

original: smra bar byed pa ni snyan pa'i tshig brjod pa'o //
analyzed: smra bar byed pa ni snyan pa'i tshig brjod pa'o //
translated: He speaks in order to utter pleasant words.

original: tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i yon tan med pa ste /üîΩde tsam gyis ni dge ba'i tshul du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i yon tan med pa ste / de tsam gyis ni dge ba'i tshul du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Just means that he has no other good qualities.

original: mi dge ba dag la yang de yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkha dog dang ni gzugs ldan pa //
analyzed: mi dge ba dag la yang de yod pa'i phyir ro // kha dog dang ni gzugs ldan pa //
translated: Just that is not the way of virtue, because that exists even in nonvirtue.

original: zhes bya ba ni yang na kha dog dang dbyibs shin tu mdzes pas sdig pa byed na yang de dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang na kha dog dang dbyibs shin tu mdzes pas sdig pa byed na yang de dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Having color and form means that if he commits evil, he has a very beautiful color and shape.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa ni 'dir bsngags pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa ni 'dir bsngags pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Having form here means having praised form.

original: pho mchog ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis dge ba ste dge ba smos pa'o //
analyzed: pho mchog ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis dge ba ste dge ba smos pa'o //
translated: The best of men means naturally good, that is, praised.

original: ci'i phyir de pho mchog ces bya bar mi chud ce na pho mchog ma yin pa la de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de pho mchog ces bya bar mi chud ce na pho mchog ma yin pa la de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it not included in the highest male? Because it exists in the non-highest male.

original: g-yo sgyu 'jungs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sgyu ni gzhan slu ba'i bdag @125b nyid kyi sgyu gang la yod pa'o /
analyzed: g-yo sgyu 'jungs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sgyu ni gzhan slu ba'i bdag @125b nyid kyi sgyu gang la yod pa'o /
translated: Possessing deceit, guile, and stinginess. Guile is the guile that has the nature of deceiving others.

original: nor dag la kun du 'dzin pa gang la yod pa de ni 'jungs pa'o //
analyzed: nor dag la kun du 'dzin pa gang la yod pa de ni 'jungs pa'o //
translated: Stinginess is that which exists in the hoarding of wealth.

original: sems gya gyu ba'i mtshan nyid de gzhan dang gzhan du ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ston pa'i bdag nyid kyi g-yo dang ldan pa ni g-yo'o //
analyzed: sems gya gyu ba'i mtshan nyid de gzhan dang gzhan du ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ston pa'i bdag nyid kyi g-yo dang ldan pa ni g-yo'o //
translated: Guile is that which possesses guile, which has the nature of revealing a false nature, the characteristic of a crooked mind.

original: ngan pa'i mtshan nyid gsum po 'di dang ldan pa ni ngan pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: ngan pa'i mtshan nyid gsum po 'di dang ldan pa ni ngan pa'i rtags so //
translated: Possessing these three bad characteristics is a bad sign.

original: gang zhig de dag rnams zhes bya ba ni gang yang bdag nyid chen po smra bar byed pa dang / kha dog dang gzugs mdzes pa dang mi ldan pa yin na yang sgyu dang 'jungs pa dang g-yo'i bdag nyid chos gsum po 'di dag rtsa nas phyung zhing thob pa bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig de dag rnams zhes bya ba ni gang yang bdag nyid chen po smra bar byed pa dang / kha dog dang gzugs mdzes pa dang mi ldan pa yin na yang sgyu dang 'jungs pa dang g-yo'i bdag nyid chos gsum po 'di dag rtsa nas phyung zhing thob pa bcad pa yin te /
translated: The one who is called that one is the one who is a great being, who speaks, and who, even though he does not have a beautiful complexion and form, has uprooted and cut off these three dharmas of deceit, stinginess, and hypocrisy.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩta la'i mgo bo bzhin bcad nas //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na / ta la'i mgo bo bzhin bcad nas //
translated: How is it?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He is said to be cut off like the top of a palm tree.

original: dper na ta la'i rtse mo bcad na shing ta la rtsa ba nas skam par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na ta la'i rtse mo bcad na shing ta la rtsa ba nas skam par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, if the top of a palm tree is cut off, the palm tree dries up from the root.

original: skyon ni bstsal pa de'i zhes bya ba de g-yo dang sgyu dang 'jungs pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩblo ldan zhes bya ba ni shes pa khyad par can la brten pas ni skyon spong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon ni bstsal pa de'i zhes bya ba de g-yo dang sgyu dang 'jungs pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro // blo ldan zhes bya ba ni shes pa khyad par can la brten pas ni skyon spong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, his faults are cut off because he has completely abandoned deceit, hypocrisy, and stinginess.üîΩThe wise one is said to be the best of men

original: pho mchog yin par brjod par bya //
analyzed: pho mchog yin par brjod par bya //
translated: because he has the ability to abandon faults based on his special knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: This is the definition of a holy person.

original: kha dog dang gzugs bzang ba la sogs pas dam pa rnams kyi rtags su nges par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kha dog dang gzugs bzang ba la sogs pas dam pa rnams kyi rtags su nges par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not that the marks of holy persons are ascertained by their having good color and form, etc.üîΩTo demonstrate this, he says,

original: 'jig rten 'di na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In this world, etc.

original: de'i tshe gos med bdun dang skra'i la ba can bdun dang / lus tsho zhing sbom pa 'khor dang bcas pa rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi sgo dag tu spyod cing gnas pa de dag gsal rgyal gyis mthong nas stan las langs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gos med bdun dang skra'i la ba can bdun dang / lus tsho zhing sbom pa 'khor dang bcas pa rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi sgo dag tu spyod cing gnas pa de dag gsal rgyal gyis mthong nas stan las langs te /
translated: At that time, seven naked ascetics and seven ascetics wearing matted hair, their bodies emaciated and huge, were wandering and staying at the gates of the Jetavana.

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas thal mo sbyar te lan gsum gyi bar du bdag gi ming nas nyan par byed do //
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas thal mo sbyar te lan gsum gyi bar du bdag gi ming nas nyan par byed do //
translated: When Prasenajit saw them, he rose from his seat, put his upper robe over one shoulder, put his palms together, and called out his name three times.

original: ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir khyed de ltar byed ces bka' stsal pa dang / btsun pa bdag gis ni 'jig rten na 'di dag dgra bcom pa lags so zhes dgongs nas /
analyzed: ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir khyed de ltar byed ces bka' stsal pa dang / btsun pa bdag gis ni 'jig rten na 'di dag dgra bcom pa lags so zhes dgongs nas /
translated: When the Blessed One asked why they were doing that, they said, ‚ÄúVenerable, in the world they think these are arhats.

original: rgyal po chen po khyed kyis shes par gyis shig / khyod kyis legs par dgra bcom pa yin nam ma yin pa ma rtogs te yang de'i sems ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes so //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po khyed kyis shes par gyis shig / khyod kyis legs par dgra bcom pa yin nam ma yin pa ma rtogs te yang de'i sems ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes so //
translated: you did not understand whether he was a true Arhat or not, and you did not know his mind as it really was.

original: rgyal po chen po lhan cig bsten pas ni tshul shes @126a * //üîΩpar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po lhan cig bsten pas ni tshul shes @126a * // par bya ba yin te /
translated: Great King, by living together one can know his character,

original: de yang dus shin tu ring po nas shes pa yin gyis gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang dus shin tu ring po nas shes pa yin gyis gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: but that takes a very long time, not otherwise.

original: de yang yid la byed cing yid la mi byed pas ma yin pa dang / de yang shes rab 'chal bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang yid la byed cing yid la mi byed pas ma yin pa dang / de yang shes rab 'chal bas ni ma yin no //
translated: And that is not by being heedless or not heedless, and that is not by having bad wisdom.

original: phongs pa'i dus su brtan pa dang / spyod pa gtsang ba dang / gtam dang 'brel ba'i gtam rab tu shes pa ste /
analyzed: phongs pa'i dus su brtan pa dang / spyod pa gtsang ba dang / gtam dang 'brel ba'i gtam rab tu shes pa ste /
translated: In times of need, by his steadfastness, by his pure conduct, and by his knowledge of how to talk and associate with others.

original: des na tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: des na tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, two verses were spoken.

original: mdog gzugs kyis ni legs par mi brtag ste //
analyzed: mdog gzugs kyis ni legs par mi brtag ste //
translated: One should not judge by his appearance,

original: zhes bya ba ni mdog dang gzugs bzang ba tsam gyis ni skyes bu dam pa zhes mtshon par rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdog dang gzugs bzang ba tsam gyis ni skyes bu dam pa zhes mtshon par rung ba ma yin te /
translated: One is not called a holy person by merely having a good complexion and form.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: zhi ba yi ni gzugs can las //
